record.title: ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, JUNE 19, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, JUNE 19, 2008 -- (Senate - June 18, 2008)

[Page: S5769]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m. tomorrow, Thursday, June 19; that following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed to have expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and the Senate resume the motion to proceed to H.R. 6049, the Renewable Energy and Job Creation Act, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
